H0.text: Two functional groups are required in each monomer of condensation polymers so that each monomer can link up with two other monomers.

H1.text: Three functional groups are required in each monomer of a condensation polymer so that each monomer can link up with two other monomers.

H2.text: Four functional groups are required on each monomer of a condensation polymer so that it can link up with two other monomers.

H3.text: One is the number of functional groups that monomers of condensation polymers must contain so that each monomer can link up with two other monomers.

A4.text: Linear polymers are produced from bifunctional monomers, i.e. compounds with two reactive end-groups.

A5.text: Polyesters arise from the reaction of a carboxylic acid and an alcohol.
